title: Abiky
author: Abiky
content: Let's say (hypothetically) governments find a way to shut down Bitcoin or centralize the whole thing. Even if they succeed, Bitcoin will survive because of its open source nature. Meaning, anyone with the code can just re-launch BTC and restore its decentralized capabilities. Not even purging or banning GitHub (or similar) repositories will be able to destroy Bitcoin. And don't get me started on Quantum computing.At this point, I'd say Bitcoin is immortal. Wouldn't you agree? If not, may I ask why?Your input would be greatly appreciated. Thank you.

comments.body: You need to find a place to run ASICs, where do you think it would be? you need to move your ASICs from one place to other place (either you bought it or you already have it), not to mention the government will investigate your place because you will consume a lot electricity.So, how do they avoid that? comments.author: stadus
comments.body: Nothing can completely shut down a decentralized network since there will always be miners keeping it alive, ensuring transactions continue. However, if Bitcoin were to be banned globally, it would definitely slow down its adoption, who would risk using it if getting caught means jail time? In that scenario, Bitcoin would likely go back to being mostly used for illegal activities, as those users aren’t worried about breaking the law in the first place.
